headline: Motorola Solutions (NYSE:MSI) Revolutionizes Public Safety With AI-Powered SVX and Assist Launch
summary: Motorola Solutions (NYSE:MSI) recently launched the SVX, a revolutionary video remote speaker microphone, and introduced Assist, emphasizing the company's focus on integrating AI to enhance public safety technology. While these product innovations demonstrate the company's commitment to advancing first responder capabilities, they did not significantly alter the company's share price, which remained flat over the past month. headline: Motorola Solutions Launches SVX and Assist, Converging Two-way Radio With Body Camera and AI Into One Integrated Device for Public Safety
summary: CHICAGO, April 21, 2025--Motorola Solutions (NYSE: MSI) today launched SVX, a first-of-its-kind video remote speaker microphone that converges secure voice, video and AI, designed for the company’s flagship radio, APX NEXT. Assist, also launching today, reflects the company’s strategy to put the power of AI into the hands of every first responder in the U.S., underscoring its commitment to ‘Solving for safer.’

content.title: Motorola Solutions Launches SVX and Assist, Converging Two-way Radio With Body Camera and AI Into One Integrated Device for Public Safety

Assist, also launching today, reflects the company’s strategy to put the power of AI into the hands of every first responder in the U.S., underscoring its commitment to ‘Solving for safer.’

thumbnail.caption: First-of-its-kind SVX converges secure voice, video and AI.

headline: Motorola Solutions launches AI tool, new device to cut emergency response time
summary: (Reuters) -Motorola Solutions on Monday launched the SVX, a device that combines a remote speaker microphone, body camera and AI assistant named Assist, to help first responders seeking ways to save time and react to emergencies.  Public safety agencies have been increasing modernization efforts and are looking for products and solutions that streamline emergency response and evidence collection.  Motorola Solutions is aiming to build on its dominant position in the public safety market with more than 60% of 911 calls in the U.S. being routed through the company's software systems.
